Description: The connection for slow traffic will be improved. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF THUN PLANNING OFFICE. Summary: Study Assignment for the Development of the Thun Sports and Leisure Cluster. Description: The city of Thun, the Swiss Football Association and private investors are working together to develop and coordinate the sports and leisure cluster in Thun West. The Thun West area is a development focus for the city of Thun. Therefore the perimeter as well The direct neighborhood will be developed further in the coming years. The Swiss Football Association is planning to build a football campus called Swiss Football Home. The private investors are pursuing the construction of a sports and leisure facility for different people Sports. By means of suitable quality assurance, in a first step (Phase 1) the common foundations are developed for the respective clusters and the interfaces are combined to such an extent that in a second step (Phase 2) an independent but coordinated development of the clusters becomes possible. The study contract advertised here focuses on phase 1. Accordingly, it is important to coordinate how the new sports facilities fit into the existing structure, how interfaces are solved and how existing situations can be further developed and upgraded. Besides topics such as access or overarching issues of outdoor space design, it is crucial to create a common image of the sports and leisure cluster. At the same time, the framework conditions for high-quality development with the greatest possible added value for the people of Thun will be defined .... Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: The Usterstrasse is classified as a collector street (usage-oriented collector street) and the bus lines 756 and N76 run there. The municipal master plan also includes a planned municipal cycle path on the same section. This is now closed realize. On the section between Sonnenbergstrasse and Giesshübelweg, the cycling infrastructure is completely missing. Furthermore, the surface from the Schossacher underpass to the edge of the settlement near Glattwerk AG is in poor condition. The roadway has many tears and patches. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT OF THE CANTON OF BASEL-STADT, CANTONAL DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT (KFÖB). Summary: Renovation of Gymnasiums and Swimming Pools Bäumlihof Basel - Bkp 242 Heating Systems. Description: Renovation of the Bäumlihof gymnasium and swimming pool, Basel: The high school was planned from 1972 to 1974 by Vischer Architekten AG, Basel. The facility in the functional style of the 1970s comprises a total of seven wings, two of which are swimming pools and six Gymnasiums. The four school wings were completely renovated between September 2014 and August 2018. Section T (gym and swimming pool) was put on hold and will be completed in the coming years. The project perimeter of the renovation is limited to this Building itself. A change of use is not planned. The conversion will take place in two stages, with the first stage being converted while the second stage is still in operation. After a moving phase and commissioning of the first stage, the second stage will take place renovated. The existing technical system will be completely replaced. With the current advertisement we are looking for a heating installer. Main CPV: 45212000 Construction work for buildings used for leisure, sport, culture, accommodation and serve food. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF HOCHDORF. Summary: Development Südiareal, Hochdorf: Feasibility Study and Preliminary Project Plus Open Space (Sia Phases 21 and 31). Description: The municipality of Hochdorf acquired the Südiareal from the Hochdorf Group in 2021 and has been pursuing a proactive development strategy since then. After the first public participation in 2022, test planning was carried out with three interdisciplinary planning teams carried out. The test planning was completed at the end of 2023 and formed the basis for the further development of the area. The planning team led by Salewski Nater Kretz developed the most convincing urban design for the southern area and was chosen for commissioned the upcoming synthesis phase to revise the draft. In a first step, the basic urban development planning was clarified, the existing building was checked for further use, the economic goals were defined and verified the socio-spatial potential is determined. A master plan was then drawn up based on the basic urban planning grid, the open space figure and the traffic concept, which now forms the basis for the upcoming special use planning and Rezoning creates. Main CPV: 71410000 Urban Planning. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Renovation of the Bäumlihof Basel Gymnasium and Swimming Pool, Bkp 244 Ventilation. Description: Renovation of the Bäumlihof gymnasium and swimming pool, Basel: The high school was planned from 1972 to 1974 by Vischer Architekten AG, Basel. The facility, designed in the functional style of the 1970s, comprises a total of seven wings, including two swimming pools and six gymnasiums. The four school wings were completely renovated between September 2014 and August 2018. Section T (gym and swimming pool) was put on hold and will be completed in the coming years. The project perimeter of the renovation is limited to the building itself. A change of use is not planned. The conversion will take place in two stages, with the first stage being converted while the second stage is still in operation. After a moving phase and commissioning of the first stage, the second stage will be renovated. The The existing technical system will be completely replaced in two stages. With the current advertisement we are looking for a ventilation installer. Main CPV: 45331210 Installation of ventilation systems. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The entrances to the station will be made barrier-free in accordance with BehiG. SBB Passenger Transport is also planning a new service facility for Thurbo regional train vehicles in Rorschach on the southeast side of the current platform system, while the city of Rorschach intends to build in the area of ​​the future Double lane expansion, at the same time a new pedestrian and bicycle underpass (FVV underpass Scholastikastrasse) should be realized.<br> The content of the mandate is the general planning services of SIA phases 31-53 for the AS35 projects, ensuring BehiG conformity, and the connection of the new service facility RONS on the new tracks and the FVV underpass Scholastikastrasse for the city of Rorschach. Heat generation:<br> The heat requirement for heating and domestic hot water is supplied via district heating from the Horgen municipal utility, from the existing district heating transfer station in existing construction<br> The performance of the existing district heating station is sufficient to supply the new building. For the supply A new low-temperature long-distance pipeline will be laid from the old heating center to the new building. The operating temperature of this will be at a maximum flow temperature of 70C.<br> In the new building there will be a transfer station or substation with a plate exchanger as a system separator and heating groups for heat distribution UG-EG, OG, air heater ventilation and domestic hot water heating provided, including all necessary equipment such as heating group pumps, shut-off, control and safety valves, expansion system, assembly, piping made of steel pipes, commissioning and handover of the system.<br> 242.4 Domestic hot water preparation:<br> The Hot water is generated via fresh water stations with the associated buffer storage heating. The fresh water stations draw their heat from this heating buffer storage depending on the load in order to be able to deliver 60C warm water to the end consumers in a continuous process.<br> With fresh water stations The hygiene problem (Legionella) is reduced to the distribution system, as this is based on the principle of instantaneous water heating and therefore only heats the water currently required (no domestic hot water tank).<br> Domestic hot water is preheated by using waste heat .... Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Renewal of the Mvr Station in Vevey, Renovation of the Historic Marquise Iii, Structural Work, Tinsmithing and Roofing, Cfc 214 222 224. Description: This call for tender concerns the dismantling of the roof, the tinwork and the wooden frame of the historic Marquise III, of the MVR station in Vevey (CFC 214 222 and 224). This will be followed by the installation of the wooden part of the frame, roofing and tinwork (CFC214 222 224) after renovation of the structure in the workshop. This item is dated 1904-1905. The three canopies of Vevey station obtained a *2* rating in the architectural census of the Canton of Vaud and the Station of Vevey is, as a whole, considered of national importance. Main CPV: 45000000 Construction works. Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: PLANNING OFFICE CITY OF THUN. Summary: Study Assignment for the Development of the Thun Sports and Leisure Cluster. Description: The city of Thun, the Swiss Football Association and private investors are working together to develop and coordinate the sports and leisure cluster in Thun West. The Thun West area is a development focus for the city of Thun. Therefore, the perimeter and the immediate neighborhood will develop significantly in the coming years. The Swiss Football Association is planning to build a football campus called Swiss Football Home. The private investors are pursuing the construction of a sports and leisure facility for various sports. In a first step (phase 1), the common foundations and interfaces are developed for the respective clusters using appropriate quality assurance widely agreed that in a second step (Phase 2) an independent but coordinated development of the clusters will be possible. The study assignment advertised here focuses on phase 1. Accordingly, it is important to coordinate how the new ones will work Adding sports facilities to the existing structure, how interfaces are solved and how existing situations can be further developed and upgraded. In addition to topics such as access or overarching questions about outdoor space design, it is central to create a common image of the sports and leisure cluster. At the same time, the framework conditions for high-quality development with the greatest possible added value for the Thun population and synergies between the various uses will be defined explored (common history based on an overall view). In order to make this common picture as robust as possible, the foundations for it should be created as part of the study assignment according to SIA 143. An overarching concept of Outdoor spaces and design principles were developed and urban planning and development issues were clarified. The responsibility for task processing lies with the lan.... Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: N02, Secondo Tubo San Gottardo (2Tg Tube North and Galleria Di Airolo) and N02, Ep 1Tg (Gtg Tube South), Bsa Lot 7003 - Cable Infrastructure. Description: In order to enable the renovation of the existing - around 17 km long - Gotthard road tunnel, the Federal Council, Parliament and the population have decided to build a second tube. The BSA equipment of the second tube, referred to as the North tube, will take place in part between 2027 and 2030 parallel to the completion of the structural work. Immediately after the opening of the North Tube for two-way traffic, the existing tube, known as the South Tube, will be replaced. The structural renovation is scheduled for 2030 to 2033. The existing BSA equipment of the Due to its age, the south tube will be completely dismantled. The new BSA equipment will partly take place in parallel with traffic operations and is expected to last until 2036.<br> Main CPV: 45310000 Installation of electrical lines. Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-12-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FEDERAL OFFICE FOR ROADS ASTRA - DEPARTMENT OF ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE-EAST - F3 ZOFINGEN

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: ZURICH AIRPORT AG. Summary: Tu-Submission - T58 - Werkstattgebaude (T3). Description: Swiss International Air Lines AG is planning to operate its own new composite shop at Zurich Airport in order to meet the growing need for maintenance and repair of fiber-reinforced composite materials. With the introduction of the Airbus A350, a particularly high proportion of such components, the maintenance requirements increase significantly. To date, this work has been carried out in rented premises, which leads to dependencies, limited flexibility and higher rental costs. With a specially designed infrastructure - which is in basic development is created by Flughafen Zuerich AG - is intended to ensure more efficient processing in the future.<br> The new building is divided into three separate parts Hall rooms for ground support equipment (GSE hall), the composite shop hall and a storage hall.<br> In the composite shop of the T58 workshop building (T3), highly specialized cabins for processing composite materials, which are intended as tenant improvements, will be installed. Additionally The existing exterior gates and the adjacent escape route doors on the west-side exterior facade of Shipyard 3 will be replaced and dimensioned according to the new requirements.<br> The new T58 workshop building (T3) is intended to create a modern workshop that will provide a sustainable, effi.... Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-12-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: This call for tender concerns the work to be carried out on the historic Marquise III of Vevey station. This item is dated 1904-1905. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: ROMANEL-SUR-LAUSANNE - TECHNICAL OFFICE. Summary: Sanitation and Raising of the Roads of Romanel-Sur-Lausanne. Description: The project concerns the renovation and enhancement of the Romanel-sur-Lausanne road service building, located at Chemin de l'Orio 29. Following infiltration problems detected on the roof, a feasibility study concluded that it would be appropriate to raise the building. This extension, designed as an independent exoskeleton-type wooden structure, will accommodate new social premises and storage spaces. The wooden posts will be fixed to the existing concrete structure to ensure the absorption of additional loads.<br> The project includes also a complete reconfiguration of the site: creation of new accesses, clear distinction between the road activity zones and those reserved for third party companies, development of additional parking lots and installation of a municipal greenhouse.<br> Interior spaces will be redesigned to meet functional and regulatory requirements (in particular those of the AEAI) with the addition of offices, workshops, changing rooms, toilets, relaxation rooms and meeting rooms. Finally, all of the facades and roof will be subject to a complete renovation including insulation and partial installation of photovoltaic panels.<br> Sanitation and raising of the roads of Romanel-sur-Lausanne<br> The project concerns the renovation and enhancement of the Romanel-sur-Lausanne road service building, located at Chemin de l'Orio 29. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FRICK MUNICIPALITY - CONSTRUCTION AND ENVIRONMENT. Summary: Seckenberg Landfill, Frick (Ag) North Extension. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: ROMANEL-SUR-LAUSANNE - TECHNICAL OFFICE. Summary: Sanitation and Raising of the Roads of Romanel-Sur-Lausanne. Description: The project concerns the renovation and enhancement of the Romanel-sur-Lausanne road service building, located at Chemin de l'Orio 29. Following infiltration problems detected on the roof, a feasibility study concluded that it would be appropriate to raise the building. This extension, designed as an independent exoskeleton-type wooden structure, will accommodate new social premises and storage spaces. The wooden posts will be fixed to the existing concrete structure to ensure the absorption of additional loads.<br> The project includes also a complete reconfiguration of the site: creation of new accesses, clear distinction between the road activity zones and those reserved for third party companies, development of additional parking lots and installation of a municipal greenhouse.<br> Interior spaces will be redesigned to meet functional and regulatory requirements (in particular those of the AEAI) with the addition of offices, workshops, changing rooms, toilets, relaxation rooms and meeting rooms. Finally, all of the facades and roof will be subject to a complete renovation including insulation and partial installation of photovoltaic panels.<br> Sanitation and raising of the roads of Romanel-sur-Lausanne<br> The project concerns the renovation and enhancement of the Romanel-sur-Lausanne road service building, located at Chemin de l'Orio 29. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF KUESNACHT. Summary: Operation of the Kuesnacht & Erlenbach Recycling Collection Point. Description: The contractor operates the recycling collection point in Kuesnacht and Erlenbach, including acceptance, interim storage, logistics and recycling/disposal of recyclable materials and waste. The municipality of Erlenbach is connected to the recycling collection point.<br> All proceeds from the recyclables and acceptance fees for waste goes to the contractor. The necessary property (wooden construction hall closed on three sides and a separate office space) will be made available to the contractor by the municipality. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: ZURICH AIRPORT AG. Summary: Tu-Submission - T58 - Werkstattgebäude (T3). Description: Swiss International Air Lines AG is planning to operate its own new composite shop at Zurich Airport in order to meet the growing need for maintenance and repair of fiber-reinforced composite materials. With the introduction of the Airbus A350, which has a particularly high proportion of such components, the maintenance requirements increase significantly. To date, this work has been carried out in rented premises, which leads to dependencies, limited flexibility and higher leads to rental costs. A specially designed infrastructure - which will be built in basic form by Flughafen Zürich AG - is intended to ensure more efficient processing in the future. Main CPV: 4,500,000 construction works. Published Date: 2025-11-04. Closing Date: 2025-12-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: The stations in Pieterlen and Selzach do not meet the requirements of the Equality Act for the Disabled (LHand) and must be adapted accordingly. The lengths and heights of platforms available as well as the slope of the access ramps to the passage lower no longer meet current requirements. The development of the CFF regional passenger traffic offer does not foresee any major changes compared to today on the Olten-Solothurn-Bienne section. This project aims to modernize access to trains and platform installation to meet current requirements. Main CPV: 45000000 Construction works. Published Date: 2025-11-04. Closing Date: 2025-12-10. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: RHAETIAN RAILWAY AG. Summary: Landquart Expansion Workshop for Thermal Vehicles and Interior Switchgear, Civil Engineering and Track Construction Work. Description: In the workshop for thermal vehicles, four tracks with pits are being expanded to a usable length of 20 m by means of a hall extension and extension. Furthermore, replacement areas will be created for material storage and office space. The tracks of the D group are located in the track field in front of the workshop halls renewed or adapted to the geometries of the new hall entrances. The indoor switchgear will be housed in the newly constructed basement.<br> The connection to the existing track system of the thermal workshop is via four new switches. The new tracks will be partly designed as gravel tracks and as a slab track. The tracks that lead into the halls are raised in the pits.<br> The addition and expansion takes place parallel to workshop operations and the usability of two tracks in the workshop must be guaranteed throughout the entire construction period be.<br> The contractor's contract advertised here includes the creation of the substructure, including all service lines and shafts and contact line foundations, the installation of the ballast including the track system, concreted tracks including switches, drainage pipes, cable pipe blocks incl. Shafts, surfacing work. In addition, various demolition and dismantling work is planned.<br> The scope of the order does not include:<br> * Railway engineering work (contact line, cable feed, safety system)<br> * Hire security guards<br> Landquart expansion workshop for thermal vehicles and Interior switchgear.... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: HOCH HEALTH EASTERN SWITZERLAND. Summary: Window Cleaning. Description: HOCH Health Ostschweiz (hereinafter HOCH) plans to outsource window cleaning to external service providers in order to ensure the long-term preservation of the value of its buildings. This tender originally concerns five locations, including the St. Gallen Cantonal Hospital and the hospitals in Grabs, Linth, Altstatten and Wil.<br> The framework agreements have a fixed term of three years with the possibility of extension for one year at a time, but for a maximum of two years in total.<br> Note: Lot 11 (Altstatten Hospital) will not be continued. Due to the definitive closure of the Altstatten Hospital, this lot is no longer applicable and the tender will be canceled accordingly (according to Art. 43 Para. 1 lit. a IVoeB).<br> The remaining lots (1-10) are not affected by this partial demolition and remain part of the tender.<br> All Interested providers have already been informed directly about the loss of the lot and the cancellation of the planned viewing on October 30, 2025.<br> St.Gallen location<br> Cleaning of windows, interior glazing and blinds according to the service description (in the documents)<br> Grabs location<br> Uznach location<br> Location Wil<br> Altstatten location<br> Doc Title: Window cleaning<br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL ROADS OFFICE FEDRO - WEST ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE DEPARTMENT - THUN BRANCH. Summary: N00.F2 Mp-250026 - F2 Route / Environment 2026-2039 - Paving Measures Ns 2026-2030, Canton be (Id 11622). Description: FEDRO is responsible for the maintenance of national roads. In order to keep the roads in good condition until the next major maintenance project, annual maintenance measures are required. As part of these measures, the areas of pavement that are most severely damaged are repaired every year renewed. Experience in recent years has shown that around 8 to 12 measures are necessary each year in the canton of Bern to maintain the quality of national roads. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: REGIONALTRAFFIC BERN-SOLOTHURN AG (RBS). Summary: New Depot Construction Including Conversion of Bätterkinden Station (groove Rail Switches). Description: The Bern Solothurn RBS regional transport company is planning to build a maintenance and parking facility (depot) in Bätterkinden. This new depot will replace the facilities in Solothurn and Worblaufen in the future. The existing Bätterkinden train station is located to the east of the planned depot facility. This will also be converted as part of the construction of the depot. Furthermore, the outdoor facilities around the depot will be rebuilt, for example as a storage and scheduling facility. RBS intends to procure the switches for the parking and scheduling facility. Details can be found in the work contract and its appendices.<br> Main CPV: 45234112 Construction of railway depots. Published Date: 2025-11-03. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: N00.F2 Mp-250026 - F2 Route / Environment 2026-2039 - Paving Measures Ns 2026-2030, Canton be (Id 11622). Description: FEDRO is responsible for the maintenance of national roads. In order to keep the roads in good condition until the next major maintenance project, annual maintenance measures are required. As part of these measures, the areas of pavement that are most severely damaged are repaired every year renewed. Experience in recent years has shown that around 8 to 12 measures are necessary each year in the canton of Bern to maintain the quality of national roads. This procurement involves purchasing the relevant maintenance measures for the next five years.<br> Main CPV: 45233141 Road maintenance work. Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-12-10. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT OF THE CANTON OF BASEL-STADT, CANTONAL DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT (KFOEB). Summary: New Walkeweg Primary School, Bkp 273.0 Interior Doors (Steel Frames, Wooden Frames, Fire Doors & Glazing). Description: Urban, social and ecological connections form the basic principles of the project for the new primary school on Walkeweg in Basel. The urban ensemble consists of three buildings: auditorium building, day structure and classroom wing. The auditorium and day structure in the south face the neighborhood square and can be shared by the neighborhood. The classroom wing in the north is dedicated to concentrated learning. The three buildings frame the Tiny Forest, a green playground and playground that is open to both students and children from the neighborhood. The task requires an innovative and sustainable school. The architecture is based on sustainable construction. It is simple, free and concrete. Low-tech concept, wood and clay constructions as well as spatially integrated photovoltaic elements. The auditorium building and day structure are oriented towards the square and have two projectiles. The classroom wing has five upper floors and two basement floors with a mezzanine.<br> Main CPV: 45210000 construction work in building construction. Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-12-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT OF THE CANTON OF BASEL-STADT, CANTONAL DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT (KFOEB)

The urban ensemble consists of three buildings: auditorium building, day structure and classroom wing. The auditorium and day structure in the south face the neighborhood square and can be shared by the neighborhood. The classroom wing in the north is dedicated to concentrated learning. The three buildings frame the Tiny Forest, a green playground and playground that is open to both students and children from the neighborhood. The task requires an innovative and sustainable school. The architecture is based on sustainable construction. It is simple, free and concrete. Low-tech concept, wood and clay constructions as well as spatially integrated photovoltaic elements. The building services are placed on the ground floor and top floor (no basement) to prevent damage caused by flood events to avoid. Description: The Technical Operations Flawil (TBF) is planning a heating network. The treated wastewater from the Flawil-Degersheim-Gossau wastewater association (AVFDG) is used as a source for heat generation using heat pumps. The new heating center will be built over the existing computing building in the Oberglatt ARA. The heating network delivers the heat to the customers' transfer stations where it can be used for heating purposes and hot water. An intelligent control and regulation system controls and monitors the entire network - from production to heat emission.<br> Main CPV: 45000000 Construction work. Published Date: 2025-10-30. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: REPUBLIC AND CANTON OF GENEVA - DT - OCEAU - SAEP. Summary: Allondon - Development of Refuge Areas for Salmonids - Installation of Artificial Ice Jams. Description: The overall project aims to create 20 jams at strategic locations in the Allondon, that is to say areas where the main current would allow the structuring and maintenance of deep pits at the foot of the jam. Furthermore, taking into account the plausibility that ice jams modify the length of the watercourse, some were placed in anticipation. The project finally plans to clear the alluvium currently blocking the mouth of the discharge arm of the Eaux Froides stream in order to restore fish migration with the Allondon. Main CPV: 45240000 Construction work of hydraulic structures. Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-12-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: REPUBLIC AND CANTON OF GENEVA - DT - OCEAU - SAEP

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SWISSGRID AG - ENGINEERING & CONSTRUCTION. Summary: Doc2667209725 - Tr Barenburg-Sils_Mastfundamente_Tiefbau. Description: The 220 kV Barenburg-Sils line is an existing Swissgrid line. As part of the immediate measures project, it is planned to replace 4 masts of the Vogeli type on the Barenburg Sils line section with an equivalent replacement. There are new foundations at the four mast locations to be attached to the existing foundations. It is important that the existing masts remain in operation/intact until the new masts are built around the existing masts.<br> The execution of the construction work for 4 the mast foundations is planned differently.<br> . Mast 1341a021: Attachment new foundations with slab foundations, in moraine.<br> . Mast 1341a028: Addition of new foundations with micropiles, in moraine with stones.<br> . Mast 1341a030: Addition of new foundations with rock anchors, in rock.<br> . Mast 1341a032: Addition of new foundations with rock anchors, in rock.<br> Furthermore, there are installation and transshipment points and assembly stations for builder and assembly work management required.<br> The work also includes temporary demolition and safety work Access roads, excavation and embankment protection, micropiles, rock anchors, grounding and repair work. The new cable masts with corner poles out of Angle profiles are incorporated into the new or reinforced bucket foundations are concreted in.<br> The detailed service components are shown in document C100.<br> F21 services for mast no. 1341a021 and F28 services for mast no. 1341a028<br> . input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: REGIONAL TRANSPORT BERN-SOLOTHURN AG (RBS). Summary: New Depot Construction Including Conversion of Batterkinden Train Station (Bkp 211 Construction Work). Description: The Bern Solothurn RBS regional transport company is planning to build a maintenance and parking facility (depot) in Batterkinden. This new depot will replace the facilities in Solothurn and Worblaufen in the future. The existing Batterkinden train station is located to the east of the planned depot facility. This should be done in the course of Construction of the depot will also be converted. Furthermore, the outdoor facilities around the depot will be rebuilt, for example as a storage and scheduling facility. RBS intends to procure the construction work for the new depot, the conversion of the train station and the parking facility. Details are in the work contract with its appendices.<br> New depot construction including conversion of Batterkinden train station (BKP 211 construction work)<br> Doc Title: New depot construction including conversion of Batterkinden train station (BKP 211 construction work)<br> Contract type: works. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SPIERBERG WATER SUPPLY COOPERATIVE. Summary: Reconstruction of the Spierberg Water Supply. Description: The “Water Supply Spierberg, Flühli” project aims to sustainably improve the inadequate drinking and fire-fighting water supply in the Spierberg area. Around 20 households, which were previously supplied by private, sometimes unreliable sources, are to be connected to a shared water supply in the future. The water comes from the Schwändi spring and, if necessary, can also be obtained from the existing Flühli water supply. Several staged pumping stations and reservoirs, a total of nine water and fire-fighting water tanks, and around 7 km of new pipes are planned. The project area is located in a sensitive moorland, which is why environmental and soil protection measures are planned. Services for the creation of a cable route for the CKW and the connection of buildings outside the construction zone to the public sewer system were integrated into the project. Construction is scheduled to begin in March 2026 and commissioning will take place in spring 2027.<br> Main CPV: 4,500,000 construction works. Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-11-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Reconstruction of the Spierberg Water Supply
output.Description: The “Water Supply Spierberg, Flühli” project aims to sustainably improve the inadequate drinking and fire-fighting water supply in the Spierberg area. Around 20 households, which were previously supplied by private, sometimes unreliable sources, are to be connected to a shared water supply in the future. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT OF THE CANTON OF BASEL-STADT, CANTONAL DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT (KFÖB). Summary: Renovation of Gymnasiums and Swimming Pools Bäumlihof Basel - Bkp 282.5 Wall Coverings Made of Wood. Description: Renovation of the Bäumlihof gymnasium and swimming pool, Basel: The high school was planned from 1972 to 1974 by Vischer Architekten AG, Basel. The facility, designed in the functional style of the 1970s, comprises a total of seven wings, including two swimming pools and six gymnasiums. The four school wings were completely renovated between September 2014 and August 2018. Section T (gym and swimming pool) was put on hold and will be completed in the coming years. The project perimeter of the renovation is limited to the building itself. A change of use is not planned. The conversion will take place in two stages, with the first stage being converted while the second stage is still in operation. After a moving phase and commissioning of the first stage, the second stage will be renovated. The existing cladding is dismantled, upgraded, temporarily stored by the contractor and reassembled. The advertisement seeks to find a suitable entrepreneur.<br> Main CPV: 45212200 Construction work for sports facilities. Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-12-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT OF THE CANTON OF BASEL-STADT, CANTONAL DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT (KFÖB). Summary: Sgs58 - Conversion of Sandgrubenstrasse 58, Bkp 273 Carpentry Work & Bkp 275 Locking Systems. Description: The building was built in 1940 as a residential building and later converted into an office building. The part of the building along Rosentalstrasse has 6 above-ground floors and an attic. There is a building offset on Sandgrubenstrasse. The northern part of the building is one floor lower. The entire footprint of the building has a basement. The property and the adjacent buildings on the edge of the block are objects in the cantonal monument preservation inventory and are located in zone 6. In the future, the building will be used again as a residential building with 37 small apartments. The necessary demolition, conversion and new construction work is part of this project.<br> Main CPV: 45210000 construction work in building construction. Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-12-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FLURGENOSSENSCHAFT LANDUMLEGUNG N1/GÄU, REPRESENTED BY THE PRESIDENT. Summary: Tender for the Technical Management As Well As the Planning and Engineering Work for the Land Reallocation N1/gäu. Description: The contract includes surveying and planning work, the project planning and construction management of the cultural engineering construction work and the ecological measures as well as the technical management (overall management) of the N1/Gäu land reallocation. Specifically, this involves rounding out and clearing up the property ownership structure (including limited real rights), structural measures to improve and supplement the land route network, the renovation of (few) drainage systems and measures to implement and realize ecological compensation (ecological networking). The order also includes preliminary agricultural planning and the agricultural development concept. Further components of the order are the coordination with the revision of the overall plan for the access area for the N1/Gäu land reallocation in the individual communities or the unified municipality, the coordination with the project “Dünern Oensingen to Olten habitat - flood protection and upgrading” and the coordination with the project “A1 Luterbach-Härkingen 6-strip expansion”.<br> Main CPV: 71330000 Various services provided by engineers. Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2026-01-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

In the extension to the existing hall there will be one A new hall measuring around 28.4 x 14.4 meters was built in steel construction, which has a mezzanine floor under terrain in solid construction. The workshop extension (17.7 by 13.4 meters) has a partial basement. There will also be a two-story intermediate building (15.7 by 8.2 meters) in solid construction created, which also has a partial basement. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: MURI COMMUNITY. Summary: Reconstruction of Storm Overflows on Dorfstrasse and Bachstrasse. Description: Village street<br> During heavy rainfall, backwater occurs along the entire length of the pipe up to the rain overflow (RUe) on Dorfstrasse, triggered by the side pipes Inflows in the sewer. In order to prevent this in the future, the existing RUe with a jump weir should be dismantled and a new RUe with a strike weir created become. Connection points such as inlet and relief channels are retained. A throttle shaft with a dry hand valve including a steel pipe is provided as a throttle device. The new use of the structure as a weir can increase the height between the floor opening and the drainage channel will be used as a pressure head for the throttle pipe in the future. The jump in height is therefore overcome within the overflow area in front of the throttle, so the possible adjustment range of the throttle is increased. The structure is followed by a new mixed water pipe with an enlarged diameter up to Bachstrasse junction. The existing line will be demolished for this purpose. The new line is created using a U-trench. In addition, side house connections must be connected.<br> Bachstrasse<br> In the event of heavy rainfall, a backwater occurs along the entire length of the pipe up to the rain overflow (RUe) Bachstrasse and is triggered through the lateral inflows in the sewer. In order to prevent this in the future, the existing RUe with a jump weir should be converted into a strike weir. Description: Due to aging damage to the asphalt concrete seal, extensive renovation work is required at the compensation basin in Pradella in order to ensure the functionality of the basin until the end of the concession in 2074. The object of the renovation is the basin embankments with an area of ​​around 13,500m2. The pool bottom is in very good condition and will not be renovated.<br> The planned work involves a complete renewal of the sealing package. As part of this work, it is also necessary to establish the connections to the edge of the pool, to the bottom of the pool and to the existing structures to redesign.<br> It is also planned to pave the entire top of the dam with asphalt.<br> Renovation of the Pradella compensation basin, construction lot 2 - renovation of asphalt concrete sealing<br> Extensive renovation work is required at the compensation basin in Pradella due to aging damage to the asphalt concrete seal. to ensure the functionality of the pool until the end of the concession in 2074. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: REGIONALTRAFFIC BERN-SOLOTHURN AG (RBS). Summary: New Depot Construction Including Conversion of Bätterkinden Train Station (bkp 211 Construction Work). Description: The Bern Solothurn RBS regional transport company is planning to build a maintenance and parking facility (depot) in Bätterkinden. This new depot will replace the facilities in Solothurn and Worblaufen in the future. The existing Bätterkinden train station is located to the east of the planned depot facility. This will also be converted as part of the construction of the depot. Furthermore, the outdoor facilities around the depot will be rebuilt, for example as a storage and scheduling facility. RBS intends to procure the construction work for the new depot, the conversion of the train station and the parking facility. Details can be found in the work contract and its appendices.<br> Main CPV: 4,500,000 construction works. Published Date: 2025-10-27. Closing Date: 2025-12-22. Competition: ICB. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CANTON OF LUCERNE, TRANSPORT AND INFRASTRUCTURE (VIF). Summary: 11636.2 Bundling Bus Stop Edges Behig, Bundle No. 2, Planning Services. Description: The Federal Act on the Elimination of Disadvantages for People with Disabilities (BehiG) requires barrier-free public transport. The project improves mobility, inclusion and sustainability. In this context, the commissioned planner provides the services of phases 3 to 5 in accordance with SIA standard 103/2020 for the project planning, tendering and implementation of around 75 bus stop edges in the canton of Lucerne. The detailed information on the relevant bus stop edges will be announced with the submission documents. The rapid implementation of the services on schedule and thus the rapid implementation of the bus stop edges is a central goal of the order. Accordingly, the planner must be able to demonstrate high performance and capacity and demonstrate innovative approaches to speedy processing. The construction work should be divided into several packages. The master builder submission for the first package is scheduled to take place at the beginning of 2027 with the aim of construction work starting in the second quarter of 2027. The approximately 75 bus stop edges should be implemented by the end of 2029.<br> Main CPV: 71320000 Planning services in construction. Published Date: 2025-10-27. Closing Date: 2025-12-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: CANTON OF LUCERNE, TRANSPORT AND INFRASTRUCTURE (VIF)

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CANTONAL CIVIL ENGINEERING OFFICE (OCGC) - ENGINEERING WORKS SERVICE. Summary: Oa 2626 - Construction of an Md Ramp for the Connection between the Pre-Bois Footbridge and Chemin De Blandonnet. Description: This contract concerns all civil engineering works and equipment linked to the OA 2626 construction project, hereinafter referred to as BIBC Ramp.<br> The BIBC ramp will allow you to leave the right bank greenway which passes by the Aventure footbridge and the Pre-Bois footbridge just before the latter. It will temporarily connect the Aventure footbridge to Vernier station via Chemin de Blandonnet and Chemin des Coquelicots. The BIBC ramp is located in an area where the environmental aspects linked to fauna and flora are important. Wild orchids as well as vipers use this site for their habitat. A link between the guardrail of the adventure footbridge and the BIBC ramp will be preserved and will allow architectural continuity.<br> The ramp measures 80 meters. It begins with a ramp in the ground and continues on a concrete structure elevated, supported on prefabricated concrete posts to join a junction platform to the Pre-Bois footbridge.<br> The work provides, in particular (non-exhaustive list) the following interventions:<br> * Carrying out reinforced concrete works<br> * Carrying out earthworks<br> * Creation of landscaping, lighting and locksmithing<br> OA 2626 - Construction of an MD ramp for the connection between the Pre-bois footbridge and Chemin de Blandonnet<br> This contract concerns all civil engineering works and equipment linked to the OA construction project. 2.... Summary: Cdm101 - General Excavation and Support Works for the City of Music in the Municipality of Lugano. Description: The assignment in question concerns the excavations and support works necessary for the realization of the "City of Music" project, located at the current RSI studios in Besso. The project includes, in addition to the renovation of existing buildings, also the construction of three new volumes. The construction of a new garage is planned, for which it will be necessary to carry out a major excavation and proceed with the undergrounding of the existing building. Furthermore, the project includes the construction of a new concert hall, which will require the construction of a pit with secant piles. Finally, a new wing will be built for training, the excavation of which will be of a mixed type, with sections on free slope and sections supported by pile walls secants. The construction of a new garage is planned, for which it will be necessary to carry out a major excavation and proceed with the undergrounding of the existing building. Furthermore, the project includes the construction of a new concert hall, which will require the construction of a pit with secant piles. Finally, a new wing will be built for training, the excavation of which will be of a mixed type, with sections on free slope and sections supported by pile walls secants. Main CPV: 45112000 Excavation and earthmoving works

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: DRIVING FORCES OF THE GOUGRA (ALPIQ). Summary: Vissoie-Niouc Gallery. Description: The project consists of building a new 8 km feed gallery between the Vissoie compensation basin and the departure of the penstock at Niouc for the Vissoie-Chippis stage, of the Forces Motrices de la Gougra SA development chain.<br> The majority of the gallery layout supply (internal diameter 3.6 m) will be excavated with a tunnel boring machine (7,705 ml) and the rest by conventional method in the soft ground (176 ml) and in the rock mass (70 ml) in Vissoie. The project also includes the construction of an access gallery (600 ml) in Niouc using a conventional method in the rocky massif, future balance chimney. The supply gallery excavated with a tunnel boring machine is covered with prefabricated reinforced concrete elements (voussoirs). Transport of excavation materials is planned by trucks.<br> In addition, the project includes the termination of a new water intake in the dyke of the Vissoie basin as well as the installation of a new penstock (120 ml) connecting the supply gallery and the existing penstock to the Navizence power station.<br> For carrying out the work, four installation places are planned: three in the Niouc sector (portal balance chimney, gate to the pickling gallery and storage space) and one in the Vissoie sector (gate to the water intake).<br> The main quantities of materials d'excavation.... Published Date: 2025-10-23. Closing Date: 2026-03-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The goal is a standardized, updateable architecture with minimal customization.<br> The order includes:<br> * Delivery, Installation and configuration of the software<br> * Complete migration of existing Oracle data (geometry, attributes, relations, symbolization, etc.)<br> * Training and commissioning<br> * Maintenance, support and advice over four years<br> Option 2 is the extension of maintenance, support and advice planned for a further six years (ten years in total).<br> After evaluating the award criteria ZK1-ZK4, the three best-rated providers (others if there is a tie) are invited to the test phase (ZK5). serves the practical testing of the solution offered.<br> Procurement of a GIS solution with migration, operation and support EW cooperative Romanshorn<br> The subject is procurement and introduction ...

Description: The MS4 project is a new extension of the Maison de la Santé located in the Entremont district, in Sembrancher. It is located on plot 477, with an area of ​​approximately 2500m2 which borders the TMR viaduct and runs along the Route de la Gravenne, access main in the village of Sembrancher. It completes a set already made up of three buildings (MS1, MS2, MS3) in order to meet a growing demand for medical and social services, and is part of an approach of continuity, modernization and opening. Main CPV: 45000000 Construction works. Published Date: 2025-10-18. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
